name: Omni San Diego Hotel

reviews.title: Perfect for Catchin a Ballgame!!!
reviews.text: The Omni hotel is definitely a 4 star hotel. The layout makes the whole place feel bigger than it actually is and is very asthetically pleasing. The restaurant is overpriced, and with so many great ones within walking distance, dont bother. The best thing about the hotel though is the skybridge into Petco Park. We were down from San Francisco to catch a few Giants games, and using the sky bridge made us feel like VIPs! After the game, check out the bar/restaurant Dick's Last Resort. Rockin good times!!!
I couldn't have been more pleased. My room was on the top floor facing the convention center and the bay. The view was incredible!
reviews.title: The Omni San Diego is Fantastic

reviews.text: I arrived late due to a major delay in my flight. When I finally got to the hotel (at midnight) I was welcomed as an old friend, even though it was my first stay at the Omni and my first visit to San Diego.
reviews.title: Great Option
Major problems, poor service
reviews.text: Everyone at the hotel provided exceptional service, from the concierge to the parking valet to everyone at the front desk to the people who cleaned the room daily.

reviews.title: Nice and clean
reviews.text: Location: How can you beat it? At the edge of the happening Gaslamp district, directly across the street from the convention center, and the Omni is attached to the Padres' Petco Park stadium (hint: take one of the tours of the stadium; you won't be sorry!)

I stayed at the Omni recently for a conference, and I was very pleased with my stay. I had asked for a corner, high-floor room if available, and that's exactly what I got, with a great view of Petco Park to boot. The room was decorated nicely and the bathroom was spotless (only little peeve, and I say this all the time for hotel bathrooms: not enough towel hooks/racks!). The staff were friendly and responsive and I didn't have a problem with noise as other reviewers did. The location of this hotel is fantastic if you are attending a conference, since it's only a 5-minute walk to the convention center, and a few steps to the Gaslamp District. The only suggestions I would make: update the TVs (old style, smaller TVs), and get softer bath towels. I was surprised that a hotel of this caliber had towels like sandpaper. The bathrobes were nice, though, and not scratchy! Be sure to join the Omni Frequent Guest program, as this will give you free Internet access and free beverages delivered to your room in the morning.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: I love to travel. My stay at the Omni San Diego Hotel is in the top 5 of my hotel stays. The Hotel honored my request for a corner room. The view and balcony was great! I had many choices of hotels in the area and I am glad I chose the Omni. I would definetly stay here again if I am in San Diego.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: My only compaints are the old televisions and the train noise at night (which I believe the latter is beyond the hotels control).
reviews.title: Modern, Clean, Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was prefect for my need. I was attending a conference at the convention center and it was a short 5 minute walk. Located right next to the gas lamp district there was plenty to do in the evenings. The trolley stops right in front of the hotel as well. Room was clean and modern. I had a view directly into the baseball stadium which was kinda neat. Staff was friendly through out the trip. Coffee shop was the only disappointment, one morning I ordered an iced mocha frappe and basically got a chocolate shake.
reviews.title: Staff pleasant, accomodations satisfactory

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked in after using Hot wire to get a reduced rate. We parked overnight in the city owned parking on the corner of 4th and Tony Gywnn Way. There or no in and out privileges, but at $14 its very reasonable. So if you plan to just hang out downtown this beats the hotel overnight rate of $32 plus the customary tipping.
reviews.title: Excellent staff - noisy in the rooms

reviews.text: Walking in the hotel I thought it was pretty nice.. No one was in line and one of the front desk ppl saw me but did not acknowledge my presence..She looked at me and just looked back down, good thing another employee came and said "May I help you?". Although he did not offer me the omni select guest even when I did ask him about the wifi.. I stayed at the hotel for 4 days and did not know I could sign up for select guest till 2 days after. I felt like These front desk ppl were being a little snotty cause I am young. Booooo!
reviews.title: The hotel itself was really nice, Can't say the same about the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway, The room was OKAY nothing AMAZING.. probably a 3 star room in a 4 star hotel. lol. Our garbage was not emptied.. I hired a make up artist to do my make up for my cousins wedding and when she saw the bathroom she was like "OMG, they need to empty out your garbage!" I felt embarrassed when she said that. The bathtub also needed some cleaning but when we came in we were all so tired we didn't even bother.
reviews.title: Hotel was as terrific as San Diego

reviews.text: The pool was verrrry nice though! we went down there a few times and had a couple of drinks. Quite relaxing. The area of the hotel is great we could just walk anywhere. I don't know if i'll stay here again.. but i won't completely x it out of my list when going to san diego.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel with classy rooms and understated elegance.

reviews.text: The staff met every need that I had. On my last night, the snack/coffee bar was closed and the front desk clerk went to housekeeping to score some awesome chocolate chip cookiies for me. I requested a room with a flat screen tv and also a room on a higher floor. Both requests were granted although my room wasn't quite ready when I arrived at 3:15 p.m. They sent us in to McCormick & Schmick's for cocktails on the house until the room was finished. Definitely use the self park across the street. Since we were out most of the day, we were generally only paying the overnight rate. It was much easier than waiting on a valet and then having to tip in additio n to the $35 daily valet parking rate. I think the most I ever paid in a day was $15. Got a great rate on this stay through TravelZoo. $119 a night. Stayed for 4 nights and enjoyed the area, played golf nearby and had some great meals too.
reviews.title: Quality stay, quality service in a perfect location

reviews.text: I was really surprised with my visit here. After staying at other hotels near the convention center, I didnt really get my hopes up high. But the Omni really changed my mood. Prompt check in, speedy valet, clean crisp rooms, this place has got it all. The pool is gorgeous, and almost empty 99% of the time. This is more like a boutique hotel amid all the other mega chains nearby. Cons include being close to the ballpark and Hard Rock Hotel (this place has like 3 clubs and 3 bars), so expect to hear NOISE Friday and Saturday night. Also they need a better restaurant other than McCormick and Schmicks, really, who wants to eat breakfast at a seafood place?? Overall though, this place gets high marks.
reviews.title: Great experience; perfect location for Convention Center.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and accomadating! It was very clean and in the middle of all the nightlife and for those who enjoy a Padre game, there is a walkway straight from the hotel to Petco park! I will be staying there everytime I travel to San Diego! The only down side was that the bathroom door was a sliding door with a crack so there was a bit of a privacy issue if you are embarrased to have the person you are with notice or hear what is happening in the bathroom. But other than that it was amazing!
reviews.title: EXCELLENT!!!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and everything was perfect. The location is great, and the staff was so friendly and helpful! We got a free room upgrade to a corner room with a beautiful view of the water and Petco Park. We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay--so many happy memories!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Omni recently for a convention - the location can't be beat for proximity to the convention center - only about a 5 min walk. This place had some of the best service and friendliness from the staff I have ever seen.The other great thing was the fresh free coffee in the lobby from 4 to 6 am - really important for us east-coasters. If you sign up as an Omni member (free of charge on the internet), you get free in-room internet, 2 free shirt pressings, and free beverage service to the room each morning. The beds were great, with really nice comforters and plenty of pillows. The downsides were that because of the location, trains are noisy at night - so ask to be on the stadium side. The other major drawback is that the rooms are dark. There are no overhead lights so the rooms are lit by mediocre floor and table lamps. It was frustrating at times. The front desk clerk informed me that all the rooms are like that. If it wasn't for that, this place would be perfect.
reviews.title: Almost perfect....

reviews.text: The room are kind of small with crt tv, didn't know they still exist. The decor are very outdated, bathroom are okay but could be better. Location are okay but kind of noisy right next to the stadium and railroad track.
reviews.title: Very nice pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You feel like a welcome guest from the moment you step into the lobby. Everyone greets you by name and are constantly on the lookout on how to be of assistance. I can't say enough about how kind everyone is. The rooms are immaculate and comfortable. This is a top notch hotel located in an area where there is always something to do. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Customer service is fantastic!

reviews.text: Just finished a two night stay at the Omni.
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The valet and bell staff practically pushed each other out of the way to help us from our car upon arrival. By no means was this a push for any potential gratuity. To sum up the overall valet staff and bell service in one word, "professional". Just so you know, there is a $24 per day charge to valet your car. This includes all day in/out privledges. There is a small sign posted indicating this. Due to the small entrance area, it may not be visible to all. In todays day and age, this is to be expected, especially from a downtown location.
reviews.title: Excellent!!!

likes.disliked: — Join Select Guest and enjoy free morning beverages.

reviews.text: Check in was painless and quick. The issue arose around connecting rooms which I had requested via the company website at time of booking. By the way, I tried to book this hotel at almost every travel web site known to man with no success. Went to the hotel site at the 11th hour and was successful. We were traveling with four children and it was a must to ahve connecting rooms. After what looked like a potential glitch, the front desk manager, came over and handled it, no questions asked. He even upgraded us to the bay view side of the tower and did it with a smile.
reviews.title: Very modern but busy hotel

likes.liked: — Very clean, spacious rooms, comfortable beds
likes.disliked: — Noisy freight train in middle of the night constantly honking their horn

reviews.text: The location of the hotel was great. 10 minutes to Sea World, a few to the San Diego Embarcadero, Zoo and Balboa park. Not far from anywhere. Definitely nothing closer to Petco Park than the Omni if you care to catch a ballgame. They are connected via a walking bridge. You are at the south end of the city's Gaslamp district where there are many restaurants and bars, if you like. The area was very crowded, but clean.
reviews.title: Very polished

reviews.text: The hotel pool is small and the kids let me know it. However, the staff and the surrounding pool grounds were immaculate. Great service. Not a true test as there were only about 10 people in the pool area. Never the less, a great time.
reviews.title: Our Downtown Favorite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very busy location, but fun! Many restaurant choices in the area, but hotel restaurant is a good choice. Front desk was very helpful.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Omni last week and we felt it was great. Location was great, rooms were nice (we stayed in suite on the 19th fl) and service was great. Food was pricey so we ate outside the hotel. GO TO MARYJANES @ THE HARD ROCK FOR BREAKFAST, THEY HAVE THE BEST PANCAKES.
reviews.title: Great rooms, good location.

reviews.text: The one thing that was weird was the temperature was tough to control. The bedroom was always a bit colder than the den area.
reviews.title: wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, great place!!
reviews.title: Best Experience Ever

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Omni over Christmas week. The hotel is located at the entrance to the gaslamp quarter with many shops and restaurants nearby. The rooms are modern and clean. I agree the sliding bathroom door is a bit odd. Staff was friendly, and service was excellent. Room service was good. I recommend joining the select guest program to get free internet, newspaper, and morning drinks. The fitness room is well equipped. Location of the hotel is very central; not far from the zoo, Seaworld, Coronado, and shopping (Horton Plaza a few blocks away, and many other malls a short drive away). I highly recommend the Omni.
reviews.title: Nice place...some issues with the restaurant

likes.liked: — Clean, comfortable, modern room. Great service.
likes.disliked: — Funky bathroom door and bad experience in the restaurant.

reviews.title: Nice hotel, No privacy in bathrooms
reviews.text: My sister's and I spent one night in San Diego for a quick vacation, and we chose the Omni because the location was convenient, and it was one of the least expensive of the "nicer" hotels. Overall, we were satisfied...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Great hotel, great experience

likes.liked: — Beautiful rooms and great beds, great location to Gaslamp Quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Beautiful hotel--modern decor and high class atmosphere.
reviews.title: very pretty hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Great location! Close to the trendy Gas Lamp District, light rail, and other downtown attractions.
reviews.title: Still awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Wonderful staff--they were more than happy to help with all of our requests, and couldn't have been nicer.
reviews.title: Part of a convention?

likes.disliked: — not made for the individual traveller

reviews.title: The Bathroom...
reviews.text: Enjoyed the Omni!!
Positives:
reviews.title: Great hotel, a couple of complaints

reviews.text: + Soft Blankets....Huge Bed
reviews.title: Great location....overpriced, letdown

reviews.text: + Bathroom!! (I love the fact that there are blinds from the bedroom and the doors are sliding....Love it!!)
reviews.title: Good time!
The Omni in Gaslamp area...baseball, bars and the bathroom door!
reviews.text: + I requested to be placed on one of the higher floors with a view of the Bay and I received both.

I spent two great nights at the Omni Hotel in San Diego from Nov.22 thru Nov. 24th. From the moment I walked in I thought Wow! The lobby is modern and beautiful. We booked a premium room which guarantees a view of the bay. I thought the guy at the front desk was very professional and friendly. Our room was really nice and the bathroom was spacious and trendy. I will have to agree with the other reviewers on the sliding bathroom door. It doesn't close all the way, so it's slightly ajar. It was a big problem for us. If your shy it might be an issue. Even though we were on the 20th floor I heard the trains passing by. It was terrible, but I don't think it matters what floor your on. You can't get a way from the trains. Unless, maybe you book a room that faces downtown. Not sure. The view from my room was spectacular and worth the extra we paid. Since the hotel is right next to the convention center, you never know what's going on there. Thanksgiving morning I was woke up at 7:30am with bluesy music playing really loud. I thought maybe it was the people next door. I called the front desk and they said it was a concert going on at the convention center. I felt like I was about ten rows back from the stage. They apologized and offered ear plugs, which I gladly took. Thank God I was able to go back to sleep. So check the convention center schedule and maybe let that determine which side of the hotel you book the room. Again everyone was really nice. Oh, the beds are to die for. It was super comfortable and more soft than firm. I usually prefer firm mattresses but this was pretty nice. Slept really well except for the situation I mentioned earlier. We didn't eat at any of the hotel restaurants. Everything is in walking distance of the hotel. Bars, restaurants, movie theaters, shopping. We didn't get into the car once. We parked across the street instead of valet which was $24. The parking structure was $8 per day. So if you're going to stay longer than two days with a car. Price compare and see which is more cost effective. I would definitely go back, but I'd probably just make sure I'm on the other side of the hotel. It was good times though!
reviews.title: Enjoyed My Stay

reviews.text: Trish
reviews.title: Great Convention hotel
Great Location
reviews.text: Hollywood, CA

Visited the OMNi as part of a convention in San Diego and the hotel is ideally situated for that purpose. It is also close to many bars and restuarants. The rooms are very good but there is a lot of noise from the train line that runs in front of the hotel - if you are a light sleeper then you may be dissapointed. The bar/restuarant is not part of the hotel and is not cheap, (except for happy hour which has some great food deals).The staff in the bar were very friendly, but a bit young and too overconcerned with each other and not with the guests. Shame as it clouds your judgement of the hotel, the staff employed by the hotel were much more professional.
reviews.title: Extremely convenient and comfortable

reviews.text: This was a business trip with my husband, so we had no control over where we stayed. But it turned out to be a good thing, newer hotel, great location, very clean, next to the new Petco Stadium and close to the gaslamp district with lots of shopping and fabulous resataurants. Could walk to many places.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in good location but not worth the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't know of a better hotel experience (and value) in the Gaslamp District. Stayed for one night with Omni's Double Bubble Romance Package. For about $45 more than the AAA room rate (select a Premier room), they lavish you with champagne, rose petals, $50 breakfast voucher and two mimosas, plus they put you in the best rooms! Service was perfect beginning with a call from the concierge the week before our trip to arrange dining reservations, to check-in, to room service to valet. A short block to 5th Ave and all of the fun restaurants, bars and music. Having read some of the reviews, I was concerned about train noise, but we were on the 18th floor overlooking the tracks, the bay and the Coronado Bridge, and we never heard the trains once. Fantastic overnight trip. Will be back again and again...
reviews.title: Try the Romance Package!!!

reviews.text: I have stayed at Omni's before, but this hotel really blew the rest out of the water. Our room had a fantastic view! It was very modern and zen like in the room and the bathroom. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel for couples or friends for a girls weekend. The concierge was very helpful in helping with dinner reservations and nightlife suggestions. We booked this hotel through hotwire, so it was a steal of a deal.
reviews.title: Real Gem

reviews.text: Stayed in hotel for 5 days before ging to Las Vegas we had a great stay.The Hotel in near the Gaslamp area and is a great location for nightlife and restaurants,The hotel staff are friendly . We had a slight leak in the bathroom and they wanted us to change rooms while they fixed the problem and they gave us a voucher to use in the hotel restaurant which is very good.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT HOTEL WOULD STAY AGAIN.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1st time staying at this hotel and was very impressed. It's right next to Petco Park and across the street from the Convention Center in the Gaslamp District. It's within walking distance to everything - restaurants, bars, clubs, movie theater, bookstore, Horton Plaza, etc, so you don't even need to worry about driving anywhere and look for parking..just leave it at the hotel. No self-parking, only valet, so you can't get away with paying the $26 or $35 a day parking fee.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Staff was friendly at check-in.
reviews.title: just ok for a stopover

reviews.text: The Omni was awesome!! It is in a great location in the Gaslamp Quarter (next to Petco Park and across from the Convention Center) and is right near the Trolley system in case you want to save money and take the trolley. There are several excellent restaurants within walking distance to the hotel. In addition, they have a Kids club--they gave our kids a fun little backpack with toys and activities inside. Not to mention that every night they got chocolate chip cookies and milk delivered to our room! They loved it and were excited every night when they were about to be delivered. The only downside was that our shower head in the bathroom was malfunctioning the first night, but after a quick call to the front desk, they promised to fix within the next 2 hours or give us another room. They were excellent to deal with and immediatlty got our showerhead fixed. This is an excellent choice whether going with your family or as a couple or with friends. You will not be dissapointed.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with great locality for couples or families-yes its that versatile.

reviews.text: So glad we chose the Omni San Diego. Booked hotel/air through Priceline. Omni was perfect from check-in to check-out. Room was spacious, modern and very clean. We were on the 13th floor and had a view of Petco Park (San Diego Padres stadium). The World Baseball Classic was going on while we were there so there was activity in the stadium.
reviews.title: Omnirific in San Diego!

reviews.text: Housecleaning did a wonderful job in cleaning the rooms and making them smell fresh. Beds and pillows were very comfortable.
reviews.title: Fabulous downtown hotel with water view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was spacious with a nice shower/bath and very clean. Plenty of towels were provided.
reviews.title: Omni -- Great Stay -- Great Location

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is perfect. We did rent a car because we wanted to do things outside of San Diego. Parking at the hotel is $30 but there was a garage across the street that was less.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location, a bit noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I decided to take a break from the holiday hustle and bustle and spend a night in downtown San Diego. This was our first time at the Omni. We parked at the parking structure right across the hotel for $8/day. Check in was easy and the staff was very curtious (Skye). She gave us a room on the top floor with bay view....it was great value for $130 from the hotel Website. The noise didn't seem to be an issue since we only heard the train once about 11:00pm. Went to Blue Point for a romantic dinner and loved the food and the ambiance. In the morning after checking out, we took a nice walk taround Seaport village and had coffee and omlette at one of the little cafes there. Our favorite hotel downtown is still the Marriott Seaport Village, but we enjoyed our stay at Omni.
reviews.title: nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Omni in San Diego for two nights as a little side trip while visiting family over the Thanksgiving Holiday. I booked a "half for the holidays" special at $159.00 a night with free parking for each night and a coupon book for shopping and free coffee coupons for Starbucks. We had signed up on their website as a "Select Guest" which gives you a choice of things in your room such as extra pillows and choice of room preference and type of newspaper. If you sign up take advantage of the free beverage service in the morning and you can order a bagel or muffin for a few dollars extra. Everything we asked for was in the room upon arrival. We asked for a quiet room with extra pillows and were put in a top floor room with a great view of the city. During the night my husband and I kept getting a strange kind of smell coming from the air vent above the bed when the air conditioner turned off. It almost smelled like methane and would be gone in a few minutes. We figured that being on the top floor on a corner that we were in the path of the main exhaust vents of the hotel. I became a bit concerned the next morning when my husband returned to our room with our Starbucks coffee. As soon as he came into the room the smell was very strong and he called the front desk and within a minute there was maintenance at our door changing the filter. We didn't think that was the source of the odor so they sent a Manager up who immediately gave us a new room. Our new room turned out to be an awesome suite with sweeping views of the harbour and city and the stadium at Petco Park. All I can say is that the management went above and beyond to make sure our stay was comfortable. Front desk staff, doormen, bell hops, valet were all super friendly and always had a smile. The location is great, just steps from the Gaslamp area with great shopping and restaurants all within walking distance. The only negative was that there was a train just outside the hotel and when it went by it was rather loud. It never woke me up but you could not miss it if you are a light sleeper. To remedy that they provided ear plugs in the night stand. We plan on returning to San Diego because 2 days is just not enough to see everything the city has to offer and when we do ...the Omni will be my first choice.
reviews.title: Fantastic Getaway

reviews.text: I stayed at the Omni earlier this month on a business trip and it was so wonderful! The location can't be beat - directly across the street from the convention center and walking distance to so many restaurants in the gaslamp district. The hotel itself feels new and is very clean. The staff was so nice and friendly to us, day in and day out. The valet guys were very pleasant. My room faced the Coronado bridge and the view was great. The whole place has a very upscale feel.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: Excellent hotel with fantastic views. I had a corner room on the 15th Floor with windows facing the Coronado Bridge, Coronado Island and Pt. Reyes. It is next to Petco Park (a baseball stadium) and right in the Gaslamp District. Short walking distance to a ton of restaurants. Back to the hotel: the room was very very nice with a wide screen tv, modern bathroom fixtures and a small balcony. The room was very quiet, I know this because there was a little construction outside and with the windows closed you could not hear a thing. I would love to come back during baseball season as you can walk up a ramp right into the newish stadium.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: Good location but really corporate, typical and boring. If you are looking for a business hotel, fine. But if you want something unique, charming and lovely, this is definitely not it. Look for something more fun, we found so many great little boutiques while walking along the beach. Don't let these reviews sway you. Its an ok joint, nothing worth writing home about.
reviews.title: Typical business hotel, bland and boring

likes.disliked: — way too business, these hotels should be classified as that.

reviews.title: Great stay at the Omni
reviews.text: My husband and I recently spent a week at the Omni Hotel when he attended a conference. We loved the location: the conference centre was right across the street, the Omni is at the base of the Gaslamp District, and the public trolley is right outside the hotel. I took the trolley to go to a couple of malls on the outskirts of town - easy. Originally, my husband and I had a room just across from the elevator. We asked for a room change and got moved up a few floors and with a great view of the bay! The concierge staff were very helpful in recommending restaurants, arranging a car rental etc. We had a great meal at Chive restaurant in the Gaslamp District. I would definitely stay here again.

Stayed here a week for a conference/second honeymoon. Had done some research here, asked for a corner room with a bay/marina view and was easily granted it. I am a Omni SelectGuest Club member, which was helpful as your room requests are granted first, and free morning beverages/newspaper are delivered to your door every day.
reviews.title: Definitely worth staying

reviews.text: The room was spacious with truly great views as we had hoped. The only negative was that train tracks run right along the Omni, and there is construction going on to the East/Southeast of the hotel, so loud train whistles can be heard occasionally once or twice at any hour of the night, with heavy machinery piledrivers occasionally in the morning, though it did not bother me much as I am a heavy sleeper. Also, it should be noted that trains run across the length of Harbor Drive where several upscale hotels are located. The bathrooms did take a bit of getting used to, though they afforded enough privacy as long as no mischevious people try to open the wooden blinds while you are using the restroom (Perhaps small children would not do the best in this situation). Also, there was no fan in the bathrooms, which was slightly disturbing.
reviews.title: Very poor service
Lives up to its reputation
reviews.text: The amenities were everything we have come to expect from the Omni, with wonderful chairs/desks, comfortable beds/pillows, and a large plasma flat screen TV in our room. The maid/housekkeping services were great, and cleaned up the large messes we left every morning in an appreciated manner. The valet services were great, and we used them primarily as we came and went several times a day, and it was much easier and cheaper than parking on our own. The area was wonderful with great shopping and restaurants around as well.

reviews.title: great hotel and location
reviews.text: When it came time for checkout we were a little late for our flight, so the express check-out was greatly appreciated. Also, we had left something behind, and when we called the next day the staff informed us they had found it and were mailing it back to us. Overall, the hotel experience was great, and we would certainly come back to this hotel with our next visit to San Diego.

Excellent service from Ramon, the manager and all of the hotel staff. We came for a quick overnight for our 20th wedding anniversary and Ramon gave us a big corner room with views of the bay and Coronado bridge. There is some construction going on nearby, and the train comes by periodically, but nothing that was distracting to us. Great bedding, nice bathroom, very clean and well kept. The free high speed (4mps on my laptop)internet access is what is allowing me to write this from the room. Great access to the Gaslamp Quarter just outside the front door, movies, shopping, great restaurants. Also a nice walk along the marina to Seaport Village. We came for 2 full days and did not rent a car, everything you need is just a nice comfortable walk away. Thanks to the staff of the Omni!
reviews.title: We'll be back

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Omni 12/3 – 12/5, 2006. This hotel was high class. The lobby was spacious, clean and inviting. The front desk clerks were professional and pleasant. The room was spacious and plush. The bathroom door was different, but did provide privousey. If you are a person who has lots of cosmetics, lotions and bathroom items I found there was not enough counter space. The bed linens were comfortable – down comforter the pillows were just ok. The view for our room was horrible! We had a view of buildings being renovated. Room 2121 is not a good room if you want a view. The hotel restaurant McCormick and Schmitt I did not eat at, but visited the bar. The bar keeps were friendly and lively. Over all the hotel is nice, but I never did feel comfortable with the hotel – a bit stuffy for me. The convention center is right across the street. There is construction around the hotel. There are plenty of restaurants, pubs and shops with in walking distance.
reviews.title: Classy Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Omni as part of our honeymoon and were very impressed with the hotel and San Diego. The staff were all friendly and helpful, and we were given a lovely room on the corner of the hotel with a balcony and two huge windows overlooking the town and the conference centre (with the bay in the distance). The room was really well equipped and had everything we would have wanted - TV, DVD, minibar,, coffee machine, safe, robes, internet access (wireless and wire available in the desk) - we didn't have a laptop with us but were able to access the net through the TV with the provided keyboad for $12.99 per day. The location couldn't have been better for a visitor to San Diego; we were right on the edge of the Gaslamp quarter and we just needed to cross the road from the hotel to come across a wide variety of bars and restuarants which served great food and drink at quite reasonable prices. We were within easy walking distance from the shopping district and Seaport village which is on the edge of the bay and has lots of shops and cafes. Walking along the front of the bay in the sunshine was a delight! We were also able to walk to Balboa park and the zoo (which is spectacular and well worth a visit) - this took a bit longer (maybe 30-45 mins) however there is a tour bus which operates near to the hotel which does pick up/drop off along a lot of the tourist routes including the zoo. The Omni is also right next to a tram stop and the tram is a cheap way to get about (if you arrive in San Diego by train you get door to door service with the tram for $1.25!
reviews.title: Loved the Omni!

likes.liked: — Location is great, hotel is smart and friendly, rooms have loads of facilities

reviews.text: The only potential downsides for this hotel were as others have said. Firstly, I do think the design of the bathroom was a little odd with shuttered sliding doors which doesn't quite close fully. It wasn't a major issue but I think it's a little different!
reviews.title: Fab hotel, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, noise is definitely an issue as the hotel is right next to a freight rail track with a road intersection and there was a lot of noise coming from trains during the night/early morning which did wake us (we were on the 12th floor). There is also a fair bit of building work going on around San Diego and our room was quite close to a building under construction and there was some noise from that in the early mornings. The Omni was so great in other aspects I wasn't really bothered about these downsides but I imagine if you're a light sleeper it might be worth asking if they have any rooms which are quieter than others.
reviews.title: A perfect start to our honeymoon

reviews.text: Overall our stay at the Omni was excellent. The location is great - you can walk to all the bars and restaurants in the gaslamp quarter. The trolley is a 5 minute walk from the hotel also.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel

reviews.text: All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were contemporary and clean (upon arrival). We didn't try the restaurant, but the bar was really nice, and the service was great.
reviews.title: Newer property, great location, fantastic staff

likes.liked: — Unique decor for hotel room and lobby

reviews.title: Their quoted special price was not honoured
reviews.text: The pool looked really nice, but didn't feel warm enough to get in. We got an absolute bargain - $99 a night - but even paying full price I think we would have been happy with the hotel. We signed up for the select guest program and received complimentary morning beverages, newspaper and a corner room (as requested).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay, here is my gripe......the day we arrived there was turndown service in the evening - a really nice touch. The next day while we were out someone came in to clean our room......and did a horrible job. I am not a neat freak....so for me to even notice is saying something. Counters in the bathroom were not wiped down, all the curtains were left closed, there was wrappers from things we hadn't even used on the floor, bathroom supplies were not replenished.....apart from making the beds up, very little was done. This in no way ruined our stay at the hotel, it really is a minor thing. I guess when you stay at such a nice hotel though, that goes out of their way to get everything right, it is a surprise that this aspect meets such a low standard.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a crowded cityscape.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a great hotel, great location and super friendly staff.
reviews.title: Not as good as it thinks it is
Great hotel - Well managed, beautifully decorated, and nice staff
reviews.text: Our initial inclination was to stay at the Omni for our trip to San Diego after a great experience at the Omni in San Francisco last summer. But my traveling companion, who is a light sleeper saw the postings about the Omni being noisy and we choose instead to stay at a Marriott property. After one night at the Marriott (the accommodations were depressing) we packed our bags and moved to the Omni where we stayed for about 5 days.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a great hotel with a wonderful staff (the housekeeping staff is unbelievable) nicely decorated, and has wonderful views. It is a beautiful building with a great gym and business center.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and location

reviews.text: On the subject of noise: the hotel overlooks the water and train tracks. Occasionally during the day one could hear the occasional train horn but the noise stopped at night so it was never a problem - even for a light sleeper. Because the hotel is adjacent to the baseball stadium I would presume that once the season kicks off it will increase noise and traffic problems, but since we were there off season I cannot comment on this.
reviews.title: Omni-Fantastic! 2 Sisters get First Class Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a well managed hotel - I hope you enjoy your stay in San Diego!
reviews.title: This trip was extraordinary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and i stayed here three day pre cruise on our first visit to San Diego. It was a Hotwire booking and we could not have been more pleased with the hotel. Check in was fast and friendly, we had a corner unit, very nice and large with view of the pool. That made it easy to pick a good time to use the pool when not too busy. We loved the bathroom and the balcony, would have been nice to have some chairs on the balcony though. Doormen were very helpful and the location to everywhere we wanted to be very good. We did not use the restaurant, but had coffee and orange juice in the room for breakfast and I can still taste them, they were so good.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Cozy

description: The Omni San Diego is located in downtown San Diego, just steps from the historic Gaslamp quarter and connected via skybridge to the San Diego Padres ballpark, PETCO Park. This luxury hotel was designed with a cosmopolitan feel to compliment the sunny San Diego setting. The interior is contemporary and comfortable, decorated in warm earth tones and natural materials. Guestrooms are relaxing and well appointed with the finest bedding, upscale bathroom amenities, free wireless internet and unbeatable views. In addition, the hotel houses an extensive collection of rare baseball memorabilia, including a variety of autographed baseballs, jerseys, and a Babe Ruth contract. Whether traveling for business or leisure, a stay at the Omni San Diego Hotel is one you won't soon forget. Culinary offerings include McCormick & Schmick’s Seafood Restaurant, open daily, 6am to midnight. Offering the freshest selection of seafood in San Diego, menus are printed daily based upon local fish market supply and focus on seasonal, locally sourced, farm-to-table creations highlighting organic ingredients. Supplementing the menu is a thoughtful beverage list including progressive wines-by-the-glass and mixologist inspired cocktails with a “house made” approach. The Terrace Bar & Grill, open everyday through September, 11am to 8pm – Poolside, Level 6. In-Room/Remote Dining: 24 hours a day online. Morsel’s Café: Open everyday, 6am to 10pm – Lobby Level. Enjoy a variety of Starbuck’s coffee beverages, grab a snack to go, pick up travel-friendly sundries or a San Diego themed gift on the run.
